Package exam

Class PharmacyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • exam.PharmacyController
  • @RestController
public class PharmacyController
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the Spring application and define the filters using GET or POST requests.

public java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> retrievePharmacies()

      • stats

        @GetMapping("/stats/{fieldName}")
public NumberStats stats​(@PathVariable
                         java.lang.String fieldName)
        Gives stats based on the class NumberStats. Note: the allowed fields are latitude and longitude.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - allowed: latitude or longitude
        Returns:
        average, minimum, maximum, standard deviation and sum

      • count

        @GetMapping("/count/{fieldName}")
public java.lang.String count​(@PathVariable
                              java.lang.String fieldName,
                              @RequestParam("value")
                              java.lang.String value)
        Returns the number of times the string of the specified field repeats itself.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the Pharmacy attribute
        value - the string to count
        Returns:
        the number of unique items

      • localize

        @PostMapping("/localize")
public java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> localize​(@RequestBody
                                           java.lang.String param)
        Using a POST request it looks in the body for a latitude, a longitude and a range and through the PharmacyService returns those that are in the specified area.
        Parameters:
        param - a body that contains the filter parameters
        Returns:
        the pharmacies in a given range (km)

      • filter

        @PostMapping("/filter")
public java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> filter​(@RequestBody
                                         java.lang.String param)
        Generic filter using a POST. If the body of the JSON is a single object it searches for a field, an operator and an input value and returns the filtered dataset. If it is found an attribute called "$or" or "$and" it applies multiple filters, using the following array of objects, based on the attribute. The "$or" filter does a filter for each object and then unites them without considering multiple elements. The "$and" filter just recursively filter the result of the previous decimation.
        Parameters:
        param - JSON array with objects composed by a field, an operator and an input value
        Returns:
        filtered pharmacies

      • filterStats

        @PostMapping("/filter/stats/{fieldName}")
public NumberStats filterStats​(@RequestBody
                               java.lang.String param,
                               @PathVariable
                               java.lang.String fieldName)
        Gives stats based on NumberStats on the sample made of the filtered pharmacies.
        Parameters:
        param - JSON array with objects composed by a field, an operator and an input value
        fieldName - allowed: latitude or longitude
        Returns:
        statistics on the filtered list
